Learning¶

Train & test in batch mode¶

Train in batch version and optionnally test in batch settings Also optimize the treshold for computing accuracies

learning.Train_kmer_clf.adapted_accuracy(self, y_test, y_pred, treshold)¶

Predict accuracy with respect to a calculated treshold (inherited from Test_streaming class)

Parameters

  • y_test -- ground truth vector

  • y_pred -- prediction vector

  • treshold --

Returns

adapted accuracy score

learning.Train_kmer_clf.chi2_feature_selection(self, X_train, X_test, y_train)¶

Refactor X_train and X_test only keeping features that are correlated with the target y_train

Parameters

  • X_train -- train numpy array

  • X_test -- test numpy array

  • y_train -- train target variable vector

Returns

refined X_train and X_test

learning.Train_kmer_clf.evaluate_and_write_report(self, y_test, y_pred, treshold)¶

Predict scores and write report

Parameters

  • y_test -- ground truth vector

  • y_pred -- prediction vector

  • treshold --

learning.Train_kmer_clf.fit(self, X_train, y_train)¶

Fit the chosen classifier using gridsearch cross validation

Parameters

  • X_train -- input data matrix

  • y_train -- ground truth vector

Returns:

learning.Train_kmer_clf.get_accuracy_treshold(self, X_train, y_train)¶

Calculate the treshold to obtain the best accuracy on the train set

Parameters

  • X_train -- input data matrix

  • y_train -- ground truth vector

Returns

treshold value

learning.Train_kmer_clf.plot_CV_heatmap(self)¶

Plot gridsearchCV heatmap

learning.Train_kmer_clf.plot_boosting_learning_curve(self, X_test, y_test)¶

Plot boosting learning curve (test/train deviance = f (n_estimator) )

Parameters

  • X_test -- input data matrix

  • y_test -- ground truth vector

learning.Train_kmer_clf.predict(self, X_test)¶

Batch predict of X_test labels

Parameters

X_test -- input data matrix

Returns

prediction vector

Return type

y_predict

learning.Train_kmer_clf.preprocess_y(self)¶

Transform y into a binary vector

learning.Train_kmer_clf.run(self)¶

Run method to wrap the class methods, train and optionnaly test the model in batch settings

learning.Train_kmer_clf.split_train_test(self)¶

Split the data matrix and target vector into train and test matrices and vector

Returns

X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test

Test in streaming mode¶

Test in stream settings Also optionally prune the classifier discarding trees that use

learning.Test_streaming.adapted_accuracy(self, y_test, y_preds, tres)¶

Predict accuracy score with respect to a pre-calculated treshold

Parameters

  • y_test -- ground truth vector

  • y_preds -- prediction vector

  • tres -- treshold

Returns

adapted accuracy score

learning.Test_streaming.append_prediction(self, X_test, y_preds, y_pruned, y_test, ls_index, y)¶

Predict and append predictions to prediction vectors

Parameters

  • X_test -- input data matrix

  • y_preds -- prediction list

  • y_pruned -- pruned prediction list

  • y_test -- ground truth list

  • ls_index -- list of trees index to use for pruned prediction

  • y -- labels of the current batch

Returns

y_preds, y_pruned, y_test

learning.Test_streaming.clean_temp_directories(self)¶

Delete the intermediate file that were created during the command line call of the kmer-parser

learning.Test_streaming.create_sparse_coos(self, cols, rows, datas, col, row, data)¶

Extend existing list of coordinates with new coordinates corresponding to the kmers counts of the current file

learning.Test_streaming.evaluate_and_write_report(self, y_preds, y_test, tres=None, pruned=False)¶

Compute several evaluation metrics and save them in a score dictionary, then write report containing prediction parameters and scores. :param y_preds: prediction vector :param y_test: ground truth vector :param tres: adated accuracy treshold :param pruned: indicator if we are in a pruned setting or not

learning.Test_streaming.get_kmer_counts(self, kmercountfile)¶

Parse kmer_counts from the kmercountfile generated using dsk

Parameters

kmercountfile -- pathtokmercountfile

Returns

{kmer1:count, kmer2: count, ...}

Return type

kmer_count dict

learning.Test_streaming.map_data_to_coords(self, kmer_count, batchnumber)¶

Iterate over kmer_count dict to fill coordinates vector

Parameters

  • kmer_count -- dict {kmer1:count, kmer2: count, ...}

  • batchnumber -- iteration counter of the current batch

Returns

coordinate lists

learning.Test_streaming.parse_and_map_kmers(self, fastaname, batchnumber)¶

Parse kmers_count using dsk and "get_kmer_counts" method and map them to the correct coordinates using the "map_data_to_coords" method

Parameters

  • fastaname -- path to the fasta file

  • batchnumber -- iteration counter of the current batch

Returns

coordinates lists, label

learning.Test_streaming.parse_kmers_dsk(self, fastaname)¶

Create a kmercount file using the command line software dsk

Parameters

fastaname -- path to the fasta file

learning.Test_streaming.populate_sparse_matrix(self, cols, rows, datas, batchsize=1)¶

Create a sparse matrix using coordinate vectors

Parameters

  • cols -- coordinate vector

  • rows -- coordinate vector

  • datas -- data vector

  • batchsize --

learning.Test_streaming.predict_pruned(self, X_test, ls_index)¶

Predict using only trees retained by the method prune boosting

Parameters

  • X_test -- input data matrix

  • ls_index -- list of trees index to use for pruned prediction

Returns

prediction vector

learning.Test_streaming.prune_boosting(self)¶

Prune boosting according to the kmer redundancy: if two very redundant kmers are used for the prediction: prune one of the two trees of depth=1 with the least importance

learning.Test_streaming.run(self)¶

Run method to wrap the class methods and test in stream settings

learning.Test_streaming.write_report(self, score, pruned=False)¶

Write report containing prediction parameters and scores

Parameters

  • score -- dict containing evaluation metrics values

  • pruned -- indicator if we are in a pruned setting or not
